name: Cordelia
message: Go ahead.
Don't be shy, come in.
I followed after Cordelia into the room.
The room was surprisingly plain, with only the bare necessities of life inside.
Thinking that this was everything Cordelia had saved up in all the years she'd been alive made me feel inexplicably lonely.

name: Cordelia
message: Sorry... there's nothing here.

name: Cordelia
message: I don't really have a hobby of pouring money into my own room......
Cordelia said that, as if making excuses.
No matter what kind of person the other was, if someone else had ever entered this room, I might've thought about offering her some of my own unnecessary furniture...
If I ended up sleeping in this Bed with Cordelia, my whole body would probably be sore the next morning.
The hard-looking Bed is so small you could call it a kid's, and it doesn't look all that comfy, either.
It might be something Cordelia has been using since she was a child.
If you try to get new furniture in this village, it's not gonna be your average amount of trouble.

name: Cordelia
message: I'm glad I made the bed properly.
I don't want people to think I'm a sloppy woman.
That's a pretty suggestive thing to say.
I wonder if Cordelia is still drunk, or maybe...

name: Jonathan
message: I don't think that's it.

name: Cordelia
message: I'll admit it, after I promised you earlier today, I hurriedly cleaned up.

name: Cordelia
message: It's the first time in my life I've let a man into my room, so I didn't know what to do and got all flustered.

name: Jonathan
message: Does that mean, back then, you'd already decided it was okay to let me into your room？

name: Cordelia
message: Eh...
Cordelia blushed and looked away from me.
I felt a bit baffled by the gap between her boldness in letting a total stranger into her room and her innocent attitude.
It's just as old as the pub downstairs, but thanks to being polished with wax over and over, it hasn't lost its shine yet.
Cordelia doesn't seem to care much about decorating the room, but she's clearly not stingy about making sure the place looks presentable.
It faces a back alley paved with bricks that runs in front of the pub.
It's not very big, and doesn't look like it gets good airflow, but it's still healthier than nothing at all.
It seems to be the only ornament in the room.
It doesn't look like a replica, so it's probably something some no-name artist painted for fun in exchange for a drink or something.
It's all neatly put away.
I can't tell from here what kind of makeup Cordelia uses.
It's the only thing in the room that feels feminine-a dresser.
The top is tidy, and it looks like the makeup and brushes are stored away in the drawers.
It looks pretty old itself, so Cordelia probably didn't bring it in; she's probably just using the one her foster mother used.

name: Cordelia
message: Don't look so much, it's embarrassing.
I'm really not good at makeup and stuff.

name: Jonathan
message: It's nothing to be embarrassed about.

name: Cordelia
message: Jonathan, do you not like girls who don't wear makeup？
You invited me into your room this late at night, so...
Does that mean you're ready for... that?
The bartender outfit, which really shows off her curves, is pretty racy-even to me, who's used to the habits of modern London.
From the gap in her messy shirt, I could see the sweaty cleavage of her chest, and the sweat running down her chest trickling into that abyss really stirs up my desire.

name: Jonathan
message: Maybe I should get going soon.

name: Cordelia
message: You're leaving？
Why? Can't you stay a little longer?

name: Jonathan
message: But it's already pretty late at night.
Wouldn't it be a bother if we stayed too long？

name: Cordelia
message: No, that's not true.

name: Jonathan
message: What's up？

name: Cordelia
message: It's not like I'm saying this because I'm drunk or anything...

name: Jonathan
message: Yeah.

name: Cordelia
message: I don't want you to go home.

name: Cordelia
message: You get what this means, right？
So, does that mean you're okay with us getting into that kind of relationship？
Even though we just met today, isn't that way too bold?

name: Cordelia
message: Hey, Jonathan！

name: Jonathan
message: No, that's not okay.
It's　not　like　I　dislike　you　or　anything,　but...

name: Cordelia
message: But？

name: Jonathan
message: Isn't this way too sudden？
I mean, we only just met for the first time today.

name: Cordelia
message: Don't you want to... with me？

name: Jonathan
message: That's not it.
I　mean,　even　I,　with　a　girl　like　you...

name: Cordelia
message: Then it's fine, right? I mean, I'm the girl here and I'm saying it's okay.

name: Jonathan
message: No, even if you say that.

name: Cordelia
message: Geez, you're so frustrating！

name: Cordelia
message: Hey, you'll stay with me all night tonight, right？

name: Cordelia
message: People in this village, not a single one tries to hit on me.　　　　　　　　Am I really that unattractive?

name: Jonathan
message: I don't think that's true, but I kinda get　　　　　　　　how they feel.

name: Cordelia
message: What do you mean？
Are you saying nobody wants anything to do with me？

name: Jonathan
message: No, that's not it. If anything, it's the opposite.
It's actually harder to talk to a cool beauty like you, you know.

name: Cordelia
message: You're smooth.
But if that's really the case........

name: Jonathan
message: So what if I do？

name: Cordelia
message: If only there'd been someone brave enough.
If there was someone like that, I wouldn't have had to feel this lonely.

name: Jonathan
message: So it could've been anyone, huh？

name: Cordelia
message: No, that's not it！

name: Cordelia
message: You know, Jonathan, you're the first one who's ever made me feel like this.

name: Cordelia
message: This room's got nothing in it, right？
I can't even offer you tea, but please forgive me.

name: Jonathan
message: I'm not worried about that kind of thing.
But,　are　you　really　living　alone　in　this　room？

name: Cordelia
message: Yeah, that's right.

name: Cordelia
message: Ever since my adoptive parents suddenly disappeared, I've been all alone this whole time.

name: Jonathan
message: Aren't you lonely？
Why did you decide to stay in Arkham?

name: Cordelia
message: It'd be a lie to say I'm not lonely, but......

name: Cordelia
message: I'm a coward, so I never thought about leaving this life behind and setting out for somewhere else.

name: Jonathan
message: You'd do just fine even if you went somewhere else.

name: Cordelia
message: Maybe someone will take me with them.
If someone just pulled me along by force......
